intro: Ouratea coccinea, commonly known as the red ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite, and often elliptical leaves that are dark green and glossy. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. The botanical features of Ouratea coccinea make it a distinctive and ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
